questions.question: You are given a free month to work on any passion project with unlimited resources. What do you choose?

options.text: Develop an app or an automated smart-home system from scratch.
Draft a business plan for a new startup and pitch it to potential investors.
Write a screenplay, design a clothing line, or create a digital art portfolio.
Conduct experiments in a lab to discover a new sustainable energy material.

questions.question: Your local community center needs help operating more efficiently. Where do you step in?

options.text: Speaking to community members to coordinate volunteers and host events.
Setting up a counseling and support program for underprivileged youth.
Analyzing their budget spreadsheets to find cost-saving opportunities.
Physically repairing their broken equipment, painting walls, and building new desks.

questions.question: When browsing the internet or watching videos, which topic captures your attention the longest?

options.text: Breakdowns of how the stock market works and stories of successful entrepreneurs.
Deep dives into quantum physics, space exploration, or human biology.
Tutorials on how to tear down and rebuild a car engine or craft furniture.
Reviews of the latest gadgets, coding tutorials, or AI advancements.

questions.question: A new viral product has just hit the market. What is your immediate thought?

options.text: I want to understand the exact marketing strategy and supply chain they used.
I wonder how they designed the packaging and the aesthetic of the campaign.
I wish I could interview the founders to hear their story and share it.
I worry about the ethical implications and how it impacts society as a whole.

questions.question: You are stranded on a deserted island with a group of people. What is your primary role?

options.text: Figuring out the physics of building a sturdy shelter and starting a fire.
Keeping everyone's morale high and resolving arguments within the group.
Taking charge, organizing tasks, and devising a master plan for survival.
Studying the local flora and fauna to determine what is safe to eat.

questions.question: You encounter a completely unfamiliar challenge at work. How do you tackle it?

options.text: I break it down logically, categorize the parts, and solve it step-by-step.
I brainstorm an unconventional workaround that no one else has tried.
I dive straight into action and learn by trial and error on the fly.
I stop and spend hours reading documentation or literature before acting.

questions.question: A team project is falling apart due to missed deadlines. What is your reaction?

options.text: I step up, reassign roles, and take direct control of the timeline.
I quietly complete my own tasks perfectly so I don't drag the team down.
I call a team meeting to discuss everyone's feelings and find a compromise.
I double down and just do the missing work myself to ensure it gets done.

questions.question: You are offered a choice between two jobs. Which do you pick?

options.text: A role with a guaranteed salary, clear hours, and a precise job description.
A role at an early-stage startup where my role changes daily and pay is equity-based.
A role where I am given a goal but complete freedom on how to achieve it.
A role where I spend my days analyzing trends behind a computer screen.

questions.question: How do you prefer to make important decisions?

options.text: By looking strictly at the data, facts, and historical probabilities.
By trusting my gut instinct and how the decision aligns with my values.
By consulting several experts and thoroughly reviewing all existing literature.
By taking a daring leap; you miss 100% of the shots you don't take.

questions.question: When working on a complex project, what environment suits you best?

options.text: A quiet room with my headphones on, undisturbed for hours.
A bustling war room with a whiteboard, constant chatter, and bouncing ideas.
A predictable environment with strict standard operating procedures.
A chaotic environment where crises happen and I have to put out fires.
